message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms of difficulty recognizing faces and being able to recognize objects and name facial features indicate prosopagnosia, which is associated with damage to the ventral occipitotemporal cortex. The location of the mass on the MRI also supports this diagnosis.

The patient’s symptoms suggest prosopagnosia, or face blindness, which is often associated with lesions in the right ventral occipitotemporal cortex. The other options are not typically associated with prosopagnosia. Additionally, the presence of a 2-cm mass with perifocal edema on MRI supports the possibility of a brain tumor affecting this region.
